ARTICLE 13.02 SOLID WASTE AND STORMWATER POLLUTION PREVENTION †
Division 1. Generally
Sec. 13.02.001 Definitions
The definitions of this section shall apply to this article. Undefined terms for which a technical meaning is
intended shall be defined as defined in the city's zoning ordinance.
Collection service. Any service provided for a fee involving the picking up, transporting and/or disposal of solid
waste
Construction material. Roof shingles, ceramic tile, carpet, wood, cement, metal, brick and other materials used
to construct, reconstruct or remodel any building or accessory structure.
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 221/418
Curbside solid waste collection. Collection of solid waste by the city and solid waste placed immediately
adjacent to the street curb.
Dumpster service. Commercial type garbage receptacle.
Garbage. All animal and vegetable matter, such as, but not limited to, waste material and refuse from kitchens,
grocery stores, butcher shops, cafes, restaurants, drug stores, hotels, rooming and boarding houses, or other
places, including, but not limited to, such items as meat scraps, other food scraps, bread, bones, fruit and
vegetable peelings and remains and other deleterious substances.
Head of family or household. The following:
(1) The father or mother in a family, then residing in, or in possession or control of, a building, lot
or property; or
(2) If no father or mother, then the oldest member of the family or household, then residing in, or
in possession or control of, a building, lot of property.
Immediately adjacent to. Immediately next to.
Occupant. The following:
(1) The record owner of a building, lot, or property:
(A) If the record owner (whether one or more) is in current possession;
(B) If the building, lot, or property is unoccupied or abandoned; or
(C) If the building, lot or property is occupied by more than one family or tenant, whether
authorized by the record owner or not.
(2) The tenant of a building, lot or property if the record owner is not current occupant of the
building, lot or property, and there is only one family occupying the property.
(3) Determination of occupant; rebuttable presumption. It shall be rebuttably presumed that the
owner of any structure, material or substance which has been placed or allowed to accumulate as
prohibited under section 13.02.004 hereof is the occupant of the lot, building or property to which the
structure, material or substance is immediately adjacent.
Solid waste. Any refuse, including but not limited to trash, garbage and construction materials.
Solid waste collection vehicle. Any vehicle, dumpster or bin, self-propelled, transported or towed, used for the
collection of solid waste.
Tenant. When used in connection with the use or occupancy of a building, lot, or property shall mean the head of
the family or household.
Trash. Rubbish such as, but not limited to, feathers, tin cans, bottles, paper, rags, grass, boxes and cartons, old
clothes and shoes, ashes, grass trimmings, hedge, tree, plant and shrub trimmings, leaves and limbs, yard
cleanings and construction materials and other similar items.
Sec. 13.02.002 Penalty; removal of nuisances by city
(a) Fines. A violation shall be punishable by a fine not to exceed $2,000.00 for each violation. Each day that a
violation continues shall constitute a separate violation.
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 222/418
(b) Nuisance removal. In addition to imposing a fine hereunder, the city may remove the nuisance and recover
all its reasonable costs incurred in removing the nuisance.
Sec. 13.02.003 Placement of waste in certain areas declared nuisance
Unless expressly exempted herein, the placement of any structure, equipment, material or substance, including,
but not limited to, debris, garbage, brush, rubbish, trash, building materials, furniture, and appliances and
mechanical items of any kind on any part or portion of a public or private street, sidewalk, walkway, alley,
public right-of-way, utility or other easement, or on a place immediately adjacent thereto, where it is visible
from a public place or public right-of-way is:
(1) A public nuisance and a detriment to the safety and welfare of the general public;
(2) Tends to reduce the value of private property;
(3) Invites vandalism;
(4) Creates fire hazards;
(5) Constitutes an attractive nuisance creating a hazard to the health and safety of minor; and
(6) Is detrimental to the economic welfare of the city by producing urban blight adverse to the
maintenance and continuing development of the city.
Sec. 13.02.004 Placement of waste or structures in right-of-way
It shall be unlawful for any person to: (1) build or construct, or allow or permit, any structure, including garbage
bins or racks to be used to hold garage receptacles, to remain upon; or (2) sweep, throw, dump, place, deposit, or
allow or permit any material or substance, including, but not limited to, debris, garbage, rubbish, brush, trash,
building materials, furniture, appliances, and mechanical items, to be placed or to accumulate upon or along, any
gutter, alley, sidewalk, drain, street, or street right-of-way, or any portion of any vacant lot between the curb and
property line, unless this article otherwise so permits or expressly exempts such act.
(Ordinance 15-03 adopted 2/17/15)
Sec. 13.02.005 Receptacles; placement of waste for collection
(a) Approved garbage receptacles. The temporary placement of garbage receptacles on a street right-of-way
by an occupant shall be exempt from the application of section 13.02.004 if the receptacle has been authorized
by the city. The currently authorized garbage receptacles are limited to city-issued 90-gallon containers for
single-family residential users and 300-gallon containers for multifamily residential, commercial and industrial
users. Authorized brush, leaves and trimming receptacles are plastic garbage bags with the following
specifications: 10 mils.
(b) Placing receptacles and trash for collection.
(1) It shall be the duty of every occupant of the lot, building or property, adjacent to a right-of-way
or other location from which the garbage or trash is to be collected to place the garbage receptacle at
a location on the street right-of-way:
(A) Between the street curb and the fence or property line; and/or
(B) Where it may be easily accessible to the person or equipment collecting and removing
trash or garbage.
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 223/418
(2) In the event it is not practicable to collect and remove the garbage receptacle from a street
right-of-way, the occupant of the premises shall place the receptacle at such location on his property
as the city shall assign and designate as the most convenient and accessible.
(3) At no time shall the receptacle be placed so that any alley, drain, gutter, sidewalk, street, or
street right-of-way will be blocked or obstructed from the city's garbage collection equipment.
(c) Placing brush for collection. It shall be the duty of every occupant of the lot, building or property, adjacent
to a right-of-way or other location from which the brush is to be collected to place the brush at a location on the
street right-of-way at a location:
(1) Between the street curb and the fence or property line; and/or
(2) Where it may be easily accessible to the person or equipment collecting and removing trash or
garbage.
(3) In accessible stacks or piles as herein set out to facilitate removal of same.
(4) The placement of brush shall be along the alley or within the front yard/front right-of-way
away from water or gas meters. In subdivisions that have no alleys no brush shall be placed behind a
back fence or behind a lot or parcel or along the side yard/side right-of-way on corner lots.
(5) When placing materials, other than construction materials, along the alley or along the front
right-of-way it shall be separated from the brush.
(6) No person shall be allowed to place brush along the alley or along the front right-of-way within
four (4) weeks of the pick-up of brush within that neighborhood.
(7) Violations of this subsection shall be punishable by fines not to exceed $2,000.00 for each
violation. Each day that a violation continues shall constitute a separate violation.
(d) Violation defined. It shall be unlawful for any person or occupant to:
(1) Sweep, throw, dump, place, deposit, or allow or permit any material or substance including, but
not limited to, debris, garbage, rubbish, brush, trash, building materials, furniture, appliances, and
mechanical items to be placed to accumulate upon or along any:
(A) Gutter;
(B) Alley;
(C) Sidewalk;
(D) Drain;
(E) Street;
(F) Street right-of-way; or
(G) Any portion of any vacant lot between curb and property line, unless this article
otherwise so permits or expressly exempts such act.
(2) Place or allowing to remain at a brush collection location:
(A) Tree limbs and trunks shall not exceed three (3) feet in length.

https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 224/418
(B) Brush, leaves and cuttings, unless placed in plastic container or a garbage container to
prevent from blowing or scattering.
(C) Leaves, hedge and shrub cuttings, and small loose material other than in an approved
receptacles as set out in subsection (a).
(Ordinance 15-14, sec. 2, adopted 9/21/15)
Sec. 13.02.006 Exemptions
(a) Exemptions specified. The following acts are also exempt from prosecution and proof thereof shall
constitute a complete defense hereunder:
(1) If a person places the material or substance in a suitable receptacle as set out in section
13.02.005 at a location under the orders or instructions of the city which may be issued in writing,
posted or other public notice thereof given;
(2) If a person places the material or substance in a suitable receptacle as set out in section
13.02.005(c) at a location under the orders or instructions of the city which may be issued in writing,
posted or other public notice thereof given; or
(3) If a person places the material or substance for a reasonable temporary period, not to exceed
five (5) business days, for pick up by the city, or another party with whom the person has contracted
or made specific arrangements for pick up within no later than five (5) business days.
(b) Reliance on exemptions. Exemptions shall not be improvidently granted by the court. The burden of proof
on an exemption claim shall lie with the occupant.
Sec. 13.02.007 Collection and removal generally
(a) Except as provided for in special cases, it shall be the duty of the city to collect and remove all garbage
from receptacles once a week as required by these regulations, in a reasonable and expeditious manner. The city
manager shall be responsible for establishing collection routes, days and times for collection.
(b) Nothing herein shall require the collection and disposal by the city of garbage and trash items which are of
such a nature and size as to not allow for the collection and disposal of garbage and trash; it being the
responsibility of the person, disposing of such items to arrange for removal and disposal.
Sec. 13.02.008 Removal of dirt and trash from yard leveling, landscaping, etc.
(a) It shall be the duty of a party responsible for dirt, trash and turf resulting from yard leveling or similar
work to remove same at his expense.
(b) This shall include trash accumulation of weeds, grass, trees, shrubs, or flowers resulting from landscaping,
and beautification of yards and grounds whether residential, business, industrial, school, church, public, private
or otherwise.
(c) This shall not apply to vegetation trash resulting from the operation of commercial florists, nurseries and
greenhouses where such vegetation trash accumulations result from the above enumerated vegetation items
being sold, processed or otherwise handled by such commercial florists, nurseries and greenhouses in the general
operation of their business for private gain.
Sec. 13.02.009 Removal of waste created by tree surgeons, nurserymen or landscapers
It shall be the duty of all tree surgery operators, nurserymen, or landscapers to provide their own facilities and
equipment for the removal and disposal of trees, tree trunks, or other similar accumulations of trash or debris
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 225/418
created by them.
Sec. 13.02.010 Disposal of heavy accumulations and industrial waste
(a) It shall be the duty of the owner/occupant to dispose of discarded automobile bodies, frames, or other
heavy, bulky refuse or trash, and all industrial waste resulting from manufacturing operations, canning plants,
packing plants, fruit and/or vegetable sheds, cotton gins, slaughterhouses for animals or poultry, and fish houses.
(b) A special charge for use of city disposal facilities shall be set by the city manager if said material can be
disposed of by the city.
Sec. 13.02.011 Exclusive municipal service for garbage collection
(a) The city shall be exclusively responsible for garbage collection service for all residential and commercial
accounts within the city limits.
(b) Any person, firm, corporation, association or partnership providing garbage collection within the city
limits shall be in violation of this section, guilty of a misdemeanor and subject to being fined, upon conviction
by a fine not to exceed $500.00 for each violation. Each day that a violation continues shall constitute a separate
violation.
Sec. 13.02.012 Commercial delinquent accounts
All commercial delinquent accounts that are past due must make payment arrangements within (10) business
days of the postmark of the city letter notifying the account holder of delinquent account. If no payment
arrangement is agreed upon within the ten-day allotted time the container will be removed by the city until the
delinquent account is paid in full. If the garbage container is removed the city's sanitation department will work
with the health department to close the business since no business in the city shall operate without regular
garbage removal.
(Ordinance 15-03 adopted 2/17/15)
Secs. 13.02.013–13.02.050 Reserved

(4) Class IV. 6 cubic yard container.

Sec. 13.02.052 Special classifications; classification and rate adjustments
(a) Property, premises, or buildings with two or more classifications. If any business or commercial institution
in the city shall, in the same building, premises or area, engage in business activities listed in more than one of
the use schedules above, the primary business activity of said business or commercial institution shall prevail in
the determination of the classification and rate to be charged.
(b) Business property, premises or building not otherwise classified or covered. If any business, commercial
institution, or property situated in the city is not specifically listed in any of the foregoing schedules, said
business, institution, or property shall be classified and charged the rate of a similar business listed in said
schedule.
(c) Classification adjustments. If a business function or activity cannot be properly classified according to the
above schedules, or where the classification rate in the customer's opinion is manifestly unfair, and equitable
rates under their circumstances, the city manager is given the exclusive authority to resolve the classification,
with the right of appeal by the customer to the city commission, who shall, after a hearing with the affected
party, set the reasonable rate.
(d) Reporting. In all cases in which a rate adjustment has been made hereunder, the city manager shall keep a
record of same, which shall be a public record.
Sec. 13.02.053 Applicability of charges; appeal procedure
(a) The charges fixed for collection, removal, and disposal of garbage and trash within the city shall be levied
and assessed by the city against all occupants of a building, structure, premises, or other location where such
service is received or is available.
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 229/418
(b) As soon as reasonably practicable after approval of this article, the city manager shall develop a written
procedure for hearing of appeals by customers which shall be finally resolved at the city manager's level and
submit same for approval by the city commission.
Sec. 13.02.054 Billing and payment of charges
(a) Charges for garbage collection shall be billed by the city each month as a separate item on the water bill of
all persons who received water bills from the utility billing department. For customers that get water from the
North Alamo Water Supply Corporation the garbage fee shall be billed through the North Alamo Water Supply
Corporation utility bill.
(b) Such charges shall be due and payable at the time and place and in the same manner as such water bills.
(c) A person who receives garbage and/or trash collection service and has a sewer or water charge, shall be
billed each month through regular U.S. Mail channels, addressed to such person's address, and the charge shall
be due and payable by such person to the city within ten (10) days after the date of the bill. The utility billing
department is authorized to collect all garbage and trash collection charges for the city, and shall account to the
city for such collections, and such charges shall be paid into the general fund of the city. The garbage department
shall pay the utility billing department a reasonable sum for its billing, collecting, and recordkeeping service for
garbage and trash.
(d) A person who does not receive water services from the city or the North Alamo Water Supply Corporation
shall pay to a third party as instructed by the city manager consistent with any agreement which may be made by
the city.
Sec. 13.02.055 Failure to pay charges
(a) Any person required to pay charges and who fails to do so before same becomes delinquent, i.e. ten (10)
days after the due date, shall have his/her water and sewer service through the municipal system discontinued
and his/her water meter cut off or disconnected. The city may refuse to provide water service until such time as
the delinquent garbage and trash service charge is paid in full.
(b) If any person has his/her garbage and trash collection service discontinued by the city, said garbage must
otherwise be collected and disposed of by such person. It shall be a violation to fail to collect and dispose of said
garbage and trash.
Secs. 13.02.056–13.02.100 Reserved
Division 3. Private Collectors
Sec. 13.02.101 City to be notified of yard and construction site cleanup
Any property owner who engages the services of a person to perform yard cleanup, including trimming trees and
brush or construction site cleanup, and who will produce trimmings or other material that can be disposed of in
the city's standard solid waste containers, shall promptly notify the city of the week during which the cleanup
will take place.
Sec. 13.02.102 Vehicles; containers; duties of permittee on termination of service
(a) All vehicles used in the collection of garbage and trash by any permittee within the city shall meet the
minimum specifications relating to safety and health as promulgated and established by the department of state
health services for the purposes of collection of garbage and trash within the city.
(b) It shall be the obligation of the permittee to see that all containers used for trash collection by the
permittee meet the specifications for such containers.

https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 230/418
(c) It shall be unlawful to use city right-of-way for the purpose of storing or collecting garbage or trash from
any commercial-type dumpster container, by any permittee.
(d) It shall be the responsibility of the permittee to remove the container and any accumulation of garbage,
trash, or brush should any customer of a permittee cancel or have service canceled as a final collection. The
permittee shall notify the city of the date of termination and the date of the above-mentioned final collection.
Sec. 13.02.103 Collectors operating on effective date
All persons collecting garbage and trash, other than the city, who come under the provisions of this division shall
apply for a permit from the city within thirty (30) days from the effective date. Any such persons applying for a
permit within the time limit as specified above or who shall have applied for renewal of a permit within the
appropriate time period shall have the right to continue operations during the pendency of the consideration of
such person's permit application.
(Ordinance 15-03 adopted 2/17/15)
ARTICLE 13.03 WATER AND SEWER SERVICE*
Division 1. Generally
Sec. 13.03.001 Definitions
The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this division, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in
this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning:
Utility. Water, sewer and/or any other utility service furnished by the city to consumers thereof.
(Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (2), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.002 Penalty
Any person violating any of the provisions of this division shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor, and, upon
conviction, shall be subject to a fine in accordance to a maximum of five hundred dollars ($500.00). Each
transaction in violation of any of the provisions hereof shall be deemed a separate offense. (Ordinance 99-014,
sec. IV, adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.003 Enforcement
It shall be the duty of the mayor and/or his designated officer to enforce this division in accordance with chapter
54 of the Texas Local Government Code and any other relevant statutes. If such violation is not corrected within
the statutory period, the mayor and/or his designated officer is hereby authorized and directed to cause any
utility service to be disconnected. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. III, adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.004 Applicability
All pertinent provisions of this division are hereby made a part of the terms and conditions whereby the city
shall furnish any utility service to any person, or whereby the city shall make any utility connections, or perform
any work of any kind in connection with the furnishing of any utility service pursuant to the rules and
regulations of the city commission. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (3), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.005 Mandatory connection
All dwellings and businesses within the boundaries of the city's corporate limits or extraterritorial jurisdiction
(ETJ), the owners or occupants of which require water and wastewater services for the ordinary and customary
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 231/418
use and which are approximately located to water and wastewater facilities of the city such that water and
wastewater services may be reasonably provided therefrom [shall be connected to the city's facilities], unless it is
provided otherwise in writing by the city. When water or wastewater services become available to a dwelling or
business from facilities of the city in accordance with this rule, the dwelling or business must connect to the
city's facilities within a reasonable time, not to exceed ninety (90) days after service becomes available. The city
shall give notice of the mandatory connection requirement set forth in this rule to owners and occupants when
service become available. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (1), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.006 Compliance with applicable regulations
Any utility service furnished under the provisions of this division shall be in accordance with and in compliance
with all applicable technical provisions of this code, state law and city ordinances, rules and regulations.
(Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (4), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.007 Establishment of standards for installation, construction and maintenance
The city commission shall have the authority to establish by rule or regulation such standards and specifications
as may be deemed necessary for the installation, construction and maintenance of any utility service system
owned and operated by the city within or without the city and under the management of the city commission.
Such rules, regulations, standards and specifications shall be filed in the office of the city secretary. Violation of
such rules, regulations, standards and specifications shall be deemed a misdemeanor. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II
(5), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.008 Water or sewer taps outside city
In order to protect the utility service supply, the city will not make any water or sewer taps outside the city limits
until the premises involved have been inspected and approved by the plumbing inspector. (Ordinance 99-014,
sec. II (6), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.009 Right of entry of inspectors
Any authorized inspector of the city shall [have] free access at any time to all premises supplied with any utility
service by the city for the purpose of examination in order to protect the utility service from abusive use.
(Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (7), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.010 Termination of refusal of service
The city shall have the right to disconnect or refuse to connect or reconnect any utility service for any of the
following reasons:
(1) Failure to meet the applicable provisions of the law.
(2) Violation of the rules and regulations pertaining to utility service.
(3) Nonpayment of bills.
(4) Willful of negligent waste of service due to improper or imperfect pipes, fixtures, appliances or
otherwise.
(5) Molesting any meter, seal or other equipment controlling or regulating the supply of utility
service.
(6) Theft or diversion and/or use of service without payment therefor.
(7) Vacancy of premises.
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 232/418
(Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (8), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.011 Liability of city for damage
The city shall not be liable for any damage to any customer of any utility service furnished by the city due to
backflow of the sewage system, failure of supply, or interruption of service, or for any other cause outside the
direct control of the city. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (9), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.012 Application for service
Any person desiring any utility service furnished by the city shall make application for such service to the city
secretary. Such application shall contain the applicant's name and address and the uses for which such utility
service is desired. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (10), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.013 Refusal of service to persons in debt to city
The city [may] decline of [or] fail to furnish utility service to any person who may be in debt to the city for any
reason, except ad valorem taxes and special assessments. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (11), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.014 Damaging or tampering with equipment; trespassing on utility premises
It shall be unlawful for any person, not having authority to do so, to open any water hydrant or tamper with any
utility service furnished by the city to consumers, or to in any other way molest, damage or trespass upon any
equipment or premises belonging to the city connected with any utility service. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (12),
adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.015 Temporary interruption of service
The city reserves the right to cut off any utility service without notice in case of emergencies. When an
interruption in service is necessary for the maintenance and improvement of the utility system, affected
customers will be notified as circumstances permit. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (13), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.016 Right of city to restrict use
The city hereby reserves the right to at any time restrict or prevent the use of any utility service furnished by the
city during periods of emergency or circumstances demanding such restriction or prevention of use. (Ordinance
99-014, sec. II (14), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.017 Resale of service
It shall be unlawful for any person to resell to others any utility service obtained from the city except only by
special arrangement with the city commission. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (15), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.018 Supervision of connections
Connection for any utility service furnished by the city shall be made only under the supervision of the public
works director. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (16), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.019 Separate connections required
Every building, structure or consumer in the city shall have a separate utility service connection. (Ordinance 99-
014, sec. II (17), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.020 Unlawful connections
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 233/418
Any person who shall make any connection in any manner to any utility system, whether owned by the city or
not, without the prior knowledge and consent of the owner of such utility system shall be deemed guilty of a
misdemeanor. (Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (18), adopted 10/27/99)
Sec. 13.03.021 Work to be done by city employees
No person, other than employees of the city, shall be authorized to connect, turn off or disconnect any utility
service offered by the city, or remove, replace or repair any equipment connected to any such utility service.
(Ordinance 99-014, sec. II (19), adopted 10/27/99)
Secs. 13.03.022–13.03.060 Reserved
Division 2. Rates, Charges and Billing
Part I. In General
Sec. 13.03.061 Installation of connections and taps
The city hereby establishes the following general policy governing the operation and maintenance of its water
and sewer system:
(1) All connections of users to the city utility system shall be performed by city personnel or under
supervision of the city;
(2) Utility connecting operations will be performed in a manner and method determined by the city
engineer, except as specifically provided;
(3) A sewer tap may be performed by non-city personnel, but only where it is performed by a duly
licensed master plumber who is on the city's list of approved plumbers.
(Ordinance 2002-001, div. I, sec. 1.00, adopted 4/10/02)
Sec. 13.03.062 Billing schedule
The city shall bill its water and sewer customers on a monthly basis. Water meters shall be read on or before the
30th day of every month and bills shall be mailed to customers no later than the 10th day of the following
month. The city manager is hereby authorized to alter the city's procedures regarding reading meters and the
billing of customers, including changes to the number of billing cycles per month, as necessary to serve new
customers added to the system. (Ordinance 2002-001, div. I, sec. 1.01, adopted 4/10/02)
Secs. 13.03.063–13.03.100 Reserved
Part II. Initiation of Service
Sec. 13.03.101 Application for service
(a) No new utility service shall be provided to any customer unless:
(1) An application for service has been completed.
(2) The application shall, at a minimum, require the following information of the applicant:
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 234/418
(A) Name, social security number, and Texas driver's license or ID card of an adult 21 years
or older in the household;
(B) Current employer (address and phone number), if any;
(C) At least two credit references; and
(D) Legal documentation of ownership of real property (i.e., warranty deed or deed of trust).
(3) The applicant shall authorize the city in writing to inquire about the information supplied in the
application.
(4) The city's inspections department has approved the service.
(b) The city shall ensure that an application form is prepared.
(Ordinance 2002-001, div. II, sec. 2.00, adopted 4/10/02)
Sec. 13.03.102 Denial of service
(a) Service shall never be denied to an applicant by the city's finance department unless the department has
made the following determination:
(1) It is likely that the applicant(s) will incur a combined water and sewer rate in excess of $150.00
for any 30-day period; and
(2) The applicant has provided insufficient or inaccurate information to establish the applicant's
credit status.
(3) Failed to satisfy the requirements of section 13.03.103(a).
(4) Failed to clear previous insufficient funds checks to the city.
(b) Upon the denial of service, the applicant shall have the right to:
(1) Provide a third party guarantee to assure that payment for service is promptly made; or
(2) Appeal the decision denying service to the city manager.
(c) In connection with these provisions, the city manager is authorized to establish reasonable rules for the
administration of these policies.
(Ordinance 2002-001, div. II, sec. 2.01, adopted 4/10/02)
Sec. 13.03.103 Deposit
(a) New accounts. Any applicant for utility services that:
(1) Has never held a utility account with the city;
(2) Has been a previous customer whose utility service was terminated for failure to pay his/her
account; or
(3) Has previously been refunded their deposit;
shall be required to deposit at a minimum the sum of one hundred dollars ($100.00) with the city before being
provided utility services. The city manager is authorized to determine if an additional amount is required to be
7/15/2019 https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0
https://z2codes.franklinlegal.net/franklin/PrintViewer.jsp?printCollection=0 235/418
deposited on the basis of the projected use of utilities.
(b) Maintenance of special fund. The city's finance department shall take the action necessary to separately
account for customers' refundable deposits, including the maintenance of a separate bank account for these
funds.
(c) Temporary water service. Any applicant for temporary water services that requests a connection to a fire
hydrant or other service line for use in connection with a construction or other temporary use shall be required to
deposit the sum of one hundred dollars ($100.00) with the city before being provided utility services. The
balance on the deposit shall be refunded upon completion of the project after a deduction for the use and other
incidental expenses associated with that use.
(d) Outstanding balances. Any customer who requests reconnection to the utility system but who has an
outstanding delinquent balance with the city will be required to liquidate any delinquent balance in addition to
the payment of the deposit before being provided services.
(e) Refund policy. The deposit collected shall be held as a deposit, and not in trust, by the city, subject to the
following conditions:
(1) No interest will be accrued by the customer for the period of time during which the deposit is
held by the city;
(2) The city shall not segregate the amounts held in deposit;
(3) Fifty percent of the deposit shall be refunded to customers within 90 days of receipt by the city
upon satisfactory proof that the customer is the owner of the property receiving utility services;
(4) Tenants shall not be entitled to any refund of their deposit until such time that utility services
are terminated;
(5) Before a final refund upon termination of utility services, the deposit balance shall first be
applied to any delinquent balances on the customer's utility and garbage collection charge, and
remaining funds, if any, shall then be refunded to the customer within 30 days of termination of
services.
(f) Administrative regulations. The city manager is authorized to adopt reasonable regulations to enforce these
policies, including, but not limited to, the authority to retain the balance until 30 days after service is terminated
to pay for any contingencies.
(Ordinance 2002-001, div. II, sec. 2.02, adopted 4/10/02)

Part III. Water Rates and Charges

the construction of such laterals in conformity with the city's policy (subdivision development major
construction specifications and the subdivision ordinance).

(a) The city shall install a 3/4-inch water meter for each new account unless otherwise requested and

fee in cases in which the service lateral exceeds eighty (80) feet.
(e) If the water main is in the street, the meter shall be set no less than one foot inside the curbline.
(f) Table A shall be used to determine the minimum charge for making taps, said charge being payable in
advance. The water tap fee is in addition to the $100.00 deposit and $35.00 connection fee.

Sec. 13.03.145 Customers outside city limits; inoperable water meters
(a) Meter and tap fee for customers outside city limits. A water meter and tap fee authorized herein shall apply
equally to customers outside the corporate limits of the city.
(b) Rates for customers outside city limits. Water service rates for all users outside the city limits are 1.5 times
the applicable charge for users within the city limits.
(c) Billing when water meter is inoperable. Customers shall be billed in accordance with the average water
consumption for the 6 months immediately preceding the month in which a water meter becomes inoperable or
fails to register correctly. This procedure shall continue until an operable water meter is installed. The sewer rate
shall also be similarly calculated.
(d) Compilation of list of inoperable water meters. The utility department director shall compile a list and
location of all inoperable water meters, and report his/her findings to the city manager on the last regular
meeting of every month. The list shall note the approximate week or month that the water meter became
inoperative and the replacement date.
(Ordinance 2002-001, div. IV, sec. 4.00, adopted 4/10/02)

regarding what constitutes a specific type of use.

A request for reconnection or reinstallation of a water meter after discontinuance of service for the customer's

(1) If the water meter was disconnected by the city, a service charge of $25.00;

Sec. 13.03.149 After-hours reconnection of service
After termination of utility services for nonpayment of a utility charge, a request for reconnection of water
services made to the city between the hours of 5:00 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. shall include a charge of $25.00, and
shall be payable the next business day (by cash or certified check if the disconnection was due to insufficient
funds). This service fee shall be in addition to any charges called for in section 13.03.148, if applicable.
(Ordinance 2002-001, div. IV, sec. 4.04, adopted 4/10/02)

Sec. 13.03.181 Standby fee
Every tract of land within the corporate boundaries of the city (i) which is not in a residential zone by the city's
zoning regulations, (ii) upon which is a residential, commercial, commercial or industrial building or structure in
use, and (iii) which is being provided water services by the city shall be charged a sewer standby fee in the
amount of $20.00 monthly if the following conditions exist:
(1) There is no existing connection to the city's sewer system; and
(2) Sewer collection services are available for hookup within eighty (80) feet of the property.
